sen.e: It is considered that the leading political figures wore Western clothes to show that Japan is committed to absorb the advanced science and technology from the Western countries and modernize the country as a gesture in order to be advantageous in talks with the Western countries.

sen.e: On the other hand, the common people kept the traditional habit and customs handed down from the Edo period because Western clothes were still too expensive for them and because they highly valued or cared for the traditional sense of beauty.

sen.j: 1923年の関東大震災では、身体の動作を妨げる構造である和服を着用していた女性の被害が多かったことから、翌1924年に「東京婦人子供服組合」が発足し、女性の服装にも西洋化が進むことになる。
sen.e: In the Great Kanto Earthquake occurred in 1923, a great number of women in Japanese clothing were victimized because of the nature of Japanese clothing that restricts movement of the body; in the next year 1924, 'Tokyo Women and Children Clothing Association' started, and since then, clothing of Japanese women have been westernized.

sen.e: For this reason, part of the Chinese who fled the Qing Dynasty for Japan and engaged in revolutionary movement against the Qing Dynasty around 1900 during the Meiji period always wore Japanese clothing instead of Hanfu to show their resistance as the Han race against the Qing Dynasty that is ruled by the Manchurians.

sen.j: 戦時衣生活簡素化実施要綱の目的は、日本の国民の衣服を簡素化することと、繊維製品の使用の無駄を省き節約することだった。
sen.e: The objects of the Outline of Wartime Clothing Simplification was to simplify clothing of the people and to avoid useless consumption and save the textile goods.

sen.e: Since the latter half of 1990s, a lot of shops dealing with second-hand Kimono--those selling the second-hand Kimono before the early Showa period called 'antique Kimono', and those selling the second-hand Kimono after the middle of the Showa period called 'recycle Kimono'--are opened, and magazines reported about them, which ignited a Kimono boom among women.

Since the latter half of the 1990s, a lot of shops dealing in second-hand Kimono--those selling the second-hand Kimono before the early Showa period called 'antique Kimono,' and those selling them after the middle of the Showa period called 'recycled Kimono'--were opened, and magazines wrote about them, igniting a Kimono boom among women.

sen.j: これまでと異なるのは、従来の約束事にこだわらず洋服感覚で着る人が増えたことである。
sen.e: What is different from former periods is that people began to wear Wafuku as Western clothing without being obsessive about traditional requirements in Heisei period.

sen.j: 洋服地で着物や帯を作ったり、洋服と重ね着したり、足下にパンプスやブーツを履いたり、帯揚げにレースを使うなど新鮮な着こなしが楽しまれている。
sen.e: Now, people enjoy variations of wearing Wafuku by wearing Kimono and Obi made of fabrics for Western clothing, by wearing Kimono on top of Western clothing, by coordinating Kimono with western-style footgear like pumps or boots, or by using lace as the obi support.

sen.j: 和服は、腰の位置で帯（おび）を結ぶことによって長着（ながぎ）を体に固定させる。
sen.e: When you wear Wafuku, secure an ankle-length Kimono called 'Nagagi' with Obi tied at the waist.

sen.j: 腕の太さよりもずっと広い袖（そで）を持つ。

sen.j: 長着や羽織では、袖のうち一部を縫ってあり、これにより袖口は袖丈よりも短くなり、袖に袋状の袂（たもと）ができる。
sen.e: Nagagi and a kimono half coat called 'Haori' have their sleeves sewn up so that the length of the sleeve openings is shorter than the sleeve depth, which makes sleeve bags called 'Tamoto' in the sleeves.

sen.j: 洋服の袖の特徴は、腕を細く包み、袖の中の空間的余裕が和服よりも少ないことである。
sen.e: The sleeves of Western clothing is characterized in that they wrap the arms to fit them so that they have smaller space inside than those of Wafuku.

sen.j: 洋服ではボタンや締め金を使って服の一部を固定するが、和服では帯や紐などで結ぶことによって固定する。
sen.e: Western clothing had its part secured by buttons or fastener, whereas Wafuku had itself secured with Obi and cloth cords tied at the waist.

sen.j: 和服に洋服のような開襟はない。

sen.j: 和服の布地は、あまり伸び縮みしない。

sen.j: 帯の材質は布である。

sen.j: 帯に皮革が使われることはない。

sen.j: 和服を反物から制作する作業において、反物を切る線のほとんどが直線であり、布の端と平行か直角に切られる。
sen.e: Throughout the processes of making Wafuku from a roll of cloth, the panels are cut out from the cloth almost always straight in parallel to or perpendicular to the sides of the cloth.

sen.j: 一方洋服を作るために布を切るときは、曲線をたくさん使い、和服よりも複雑な形状な布の部品を作る。
sen.e: On the other hand, in the processes of making Western clothing from a piece of cloth, pattern pieces are cut out from the cloth along a lot of curved lines to be made into shapes much more complicated than those of Wafuku.

sen.j: 和服と洋服では、服を作るために布を裁断した後に発生する、使わずに余った布の量と形に、違いがあらわれる。
sen.e: A difference between Wafuku and Western clothing can be seen as the difference of the amount and shapes of cloth left after the cutting process.

sen.j: 和服を作るために布を切った後、使わない布として余るのは、反物の端の長方形の部分を除けばごくわずかである。
sen.e: When panels to make Wafuku are cut out from a roll of cloth, just a small rectangular cloth is left at the end of the roll.

sen.j: また、残った反物の端は長方形なので、別の目的に利用しやすい。

sen.e: When the pattern pieces to make Western clothing are cut out from the cloth, a lot of pieces in various shapes mostly other than rectangular are left so that they are difficult to be used for another purpose.

sen.j: 和服が伝統的な裁縫の方法により作られた場合は、縫いつけた糸を和服から後で取り除いて分解することを前提にして和服が作られる。
sen.e: If Wafuku is made in a traditional hand-sewing method, it is sewn on the assumption that the stitches are taken out from the Wafuku to break it into panels for washing.

sen.j: 切れやすい糸を使って和服を縫うことにより、縫った糸が布を引っ張って布を損傷する危険を減らす。
sen.e: Delicate threads are used in sewing Wafuku so as to lessen the risk of thread damaging the cloth when it is pulled.

sen.j: 切れやすい糸を使うことにより、和服を構成する各部の布を長持ちさせることができるが、衣服が身体を保護する力が低くなる欠点がある。
sen.e: The panels of Wafuku can last long because it is sewn by the delicate threads, but because the threads are delicate, Wafuku has weakness in protecting the body.

sen.j: 男性用・女性用とも、洋服を着たときは体の輪郭線に沿うように服が立体的に体を覆うが、和服を着た場合は、体の輪郭線は肩と腰だけに表れ、他の部分の体の輪郭線は和服によってほぼ平面的に覆い隠される。
sen.e: Western clothing for both men and women covers the wearer to fit the shape of the body, whereas Wafuku wraps the body to cover the shape with the straight surface of cloth except for shoulders and hips the shapes of which are shown over the surface of the cloth.

sen.j: 女性用の洋服では、体の凹凸と輪郭線を立体的に強調するようなデザインや作りになっているものが少なくないが、一方で、女性用の和服では、体の凹凸が隠され、筒状の外形になるような作りになっている。
sen.e: Most forms of Western clothing for women are designed and made to emphasize the shape and figure of the body, whereas Wafuku for women is made to cover the woman's figure to be a cylindrical appearance.

sen.j: 女性用の洋服では、胸元を服で覆わない作りになっている場合があるが、女性用の和服では、胸元は必ず覆われている。
sen.e: Western clothing for women is sometimes made low-cut in front, whereas Wafuku for women are made to overlap the collar high close to the throat.

sen.j: 女性が和服を着るときに用いられる和装ブラジャーは、胸のふくらみを抑えて、平らに近づける働きがある。
sen.e: A brassiere for kimono that a woman put under Wafuku flattens her bust line.

sen.j: また、和服を着るときに、体のへこんでいる部分にタオルなどの布をあてることがある。
sen.e: Before putting Kimono, the body is sometimes padded with cloth like towel to make the cylindrical shape.

sen.j: 和装ブラジャーと、体のへこんでいる部分にタオルなどの布をあてるのは、着用した和服が着崩れないようにするためである。
sen.e: The object of the use of kimono brassier and padding the body with cloth like towel is to prevent kimono appearance from becoming loose and untidy.
The object of the use of kimono brassier and padding the body with cloth like towel is to prevent kimono from having a loose and untidy appearance.

sen.j: このことは体の輪郭線を隠す結果になる。
sen.e: Those correction makes the figure into a perfect cylinder.

sen.j: なお、体型を隠すように直線的に和服を着るべしとされたのは高度経済成長時代に入ってからのことであり、戦後まもなくは、洋服の影響もあって、洋服の下着を身につけ、体の線を出すように曲線的に着るのが良しとされた。
sen.e: People began considering that Wafuku should be worn to cover the figure of the body to make a cylindrical shape only after the High Economic Growth; in contrast, immediately after the World War II, under the influence of Western clothing, it was considered ideal to wear Wafuku to emphasize the figure of the body by showing curvature of the body over kimono.
